column4: is PKG_CONFIG_PATH environment variable a standard variable? Or is it figured out and/or set up when you ./configure
i think it has a default value (probably /usr/lib/pkgconfig)
if you're getting errors, i'd suspect you're missing a -dev package
yeah I have a configure script that tells me I'm missing libraries that I have installed. It also looks for libraries older than some I have installed and I'm not sure how to handle that part
hmm. you're sure you have the -dev versions of the packages ?

I'm trying to fix 3 errors and they all look like this: checking for libgnomeui-2.0 libglade-2.0 gtk+-2.0 gconf-2.0... Package libgnomeui-2.0 was not found in the pkg-config search path. Perhaps you should add the directory containing `libgnomeui-2.0.pc' to the PKG_CONFIG_PATH environment variable
I have libgnome02.0 installed but I don't find a file ending in ".pc" anywhere
do you have the package libgnomeui-dev installed ?
sorry... yes I have libgnomeui-dev installed as well
then you should have /usr/lib/pkgconfig/libgnomeui-2.0.pc, according to pacakges.ubuntu.com
ah. that may be the problem, i'm not sure.  Maybe ask in #ubuntu+1
oops... and just noticed I'm typing in the wrong window... I hate when I do that
